Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Blapersin (defensin; natural AMPs; fungii; 3S=S; UCSS1a; more AMPs?!)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (97.4%) tofungal Bldesin. It is highly homologous to Bldesin and differs only at one amino acid (S22 vs. R here).Activity: Active against E. faecium VRE clinical (MIC 4 uM), S. aureus BNCC 337371 or BNCC 340652,  S. aureus ATCC 6538, S. epidermidis ATCC 12228, E. faecium VRE (clinical) (MIC 8 uM),   B. cereus BNCC 103930, B. subtilis BNCC 109047, M. luteus BNCC 102589, E. faecalis (clinical) (MIC 16 uM).
Literature Information.Author: Wu J, Qu C, Zhang S, Chen W, Wang S.2020
Literature Information.Title: The second N-terminal aromatic residue of the fungal defensin, blapersin, of Blastomyces percursus is essential for its antibacterial activity
